alert.note: Alert for Fentress; Jackson; Overton; Putnam (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 7:10AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Fentress, Jackson, Overton and Putnam. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 709 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms tracking towards the southeast. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cookeville, Livingston, Gainesboro, Algood, Monterey, Rickman, Cummins Falls State Park, Crawford, Clarkrange, Grimsley and Granville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
